intro: Anantherix angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf anantherix, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. It typically grows in wetland or marshy habitats, thriving in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Anantherix angustifolia is often found in regions with a subtropical or tropical climate.
